title: FETCH-003: ThreadPoolExecutor used in core/services.py - concurrency primitive in domain layer
description: ThreadPoolExecutor used in Catalog.fetch_all() - concurrency primitive in domain layer. Location: src/datacachalog/core/services.py:3,500

title: FETCH-002: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tier markers
description: Tests lack @pytest.mark.tier markers for CI job separation. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: Implement catalog.versions(name, limit=10) -> list[ObjectVersion]
description: Add catalog.versions() method to list available versions of a dataset. Part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking - Library API.

title: Implement catalog.fetch(name, as_of=datetime) - fetch version at point in time
description: Implement catalog.fetch(name, as_of=datetime) to fetch a version at a specific point in time. This is part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking. The method should resolve the closest version at or before the specified datetime using the version resolution logic.

title: FETCH-001: Tests for catalog.fetch(as_of=datetime) lack @pytest.mark.tra anchors
description: Tests use @pytest.mark.core but no TRA namespace anchors. Location: tests/unit/test_catalog.py:1647-1846

title: FETCH-004: FakeStorage exists only as local test class, not reusable fixture
description: FakeStorage exists only as local test class in test_ports.py, not as reusable fixture/adapter for versioned fetch tests. Location: tests/unit/test_ports.py:72-100

title: Implement catalog.fetch(name, version_id=str) - fetch specific version (escape hatch)
description: Implement catalog.fetch(name, version_id=str) to fetch a specific version by its version_id. This is an escape hatch for direct version access and is part of Phase 10: S3 Version Tracking.
